title: $A steadies after ECB forecast downgrade
text:
Fri, Sep 4, 2015, 11:33 AM AEST - Australia Markets close in 4 hrs 27 mins $A steadies after ECB forecast downgrade AAP â€“ 4 hours ago Print 
The Australian dollar is virtually unchanged after the European Central Bank downgraded its economic forecasts. 
At 0700 AEST on Friday, the currency was trading at 70.17 US cents, down from 70.16 cents on Thursday. 
OM Financial senior client adviser Stuart Ive said the Aussie spiked at 70.63 US cents overnight but reversed its gains following the ECB meeting, which sent the greenback higher and commodities down. 
"It was a fairly volatile session," he said. 
The ECB left policy unchanged but revised down its economic growth and inflation forecasts and hinted at more stimulus if needed. 
"It painted a very gloomy picture for the eurozone and the market just got the wobbles, hence why the Australian dollar came back down sharply," he said. 
Mr Ive said US non-farm payrolls out Friday night (AEST) will be the next major event ahead of a US public holiday on Monday. 
"The market does appear to be slightly hinging their Fed rate hike expectations on the data," he said. 
"If it disappoints we may see a short squeeze in the Australian dollar." 
CURRENCY SNAPSHOT AT 0700 AEST ON FRIDAY 
One Australian dollar buys: 
* 70.17 US cents, from 70.16 cents on Thursday 
* 84.26 Japanese yen, from 84.45 yen 
* 63.09 euro cents, from 62.51 euro cents 
* 109.65 New Zealand cents, from 110.60 NZ cents 
* 45.99 British pence, from 45.94 pence 
(*Currency closes taken at 1700 AEST previous local session) 
Source: IRESS
